did.unittitle: Russell Phillips (District 1199) Case: Arbitration of Dismissal by Lenox Hill Hospital
did.abstract: Russell Phillips, an employee of Lenox Hill Hospital in New York City, was fired in 1983 after a physical altercation on October 28, 1983, with another employee, apparently arising from Mr. Phillips' distribution of radical political literature. This collection contains union and management briefs and exhibits, and American Arbitration Association rulings, ultimately upholding the dismissal of Mr. Phillips.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Russell Phillips, who worked in the engineering department of Lenox Hill Hospital in New York City, was fired after a physical altercation on October 28, 1983, with another employee, Andres Alfonso, apparently arising from Mr. Phillips' distribution of radical political literature of the Progressive Labor Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains union (District 199, National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employees, RWDSU) and management briefs and exhibits, and several American Arbitration Association rulings, ultimately upholding the dismissal of Mr. Phillips.
